title: Update regarding BankOne
story_body:
BankOne Continues to Invest in Toledo Community

Toledo, OH - As part of its ongoing commitment to the local community, BankOne has announced the promotion of longtime Toledo resident, Emily Johnson, to Branch Manager of its downtown location. Johnson, who has been with BankOne for over 10 years, will oversee the 20-person team and continue to build relationships with local businesses and residents.

In other news, BankOne has launched a new marketing campaign highlighting its support for small businesses in the Toledo area. The campaign, which features local business owners and their stories, aims to raise awareness about the importance of shopping local and the resources available to entrepreneurs through BankOne.

BankOne has also been recognized for its environmental efforts, having reduced energy consumption by 5% across all its branches in the past year. As part of its sustainability initiative, the bank has installed energy-efficient lighting and implemented a recycling program at its corporate headquarters.

"We are proud to be a part of the Toledo community and are committed to making a positive impact," said a BankOne spokesperson. "From promoting from within to supporting local businesses and reducing our environmental footprint, we are dedicated to being a responsible corporate citizen."

BankOne has been a staple in the Toledo community for over 50 years, employing over 500 people in the area. Its commitment to the local community is reflected in its involvement with various organizations, including the Toledo Chamber of Commerce and the United Way of Greater Toledo.
